content.question: A student wants to investigate how different values of resistance affect the total current in a circuit when the resistors are connected in parallel. Which of the following circuits will allow the student to do this?

choices.label: The figure presents a circuit that contains a battery, two resistors, and an ammeter. The left side contains a battery. Moving up the left side and across the top, there is a resistor. The right side contains another resistor. The bottom side contains an ammeter.

The figure presents a circuit that contains a battery, two resistors, and an ammeter. The left side contains a battery. Moving up the left side and across the top, there is a resistor. To the right of the resistor, the circuit splits into two vertical branches. The first vertical branch has a resistor. The second vertical branch has an ammeter.

The figure presents a circuit that contains a battery, two resistors, and an ammeter. The left side contains a battery. Moving up the left side and across the top, the circuit splits into three vertical branches. The first and second vertical branches each has a resistor. The third vertical branch has an ammeter.

The figure presents a circuit that contains a battery, two resistors, and an ammeter. The left side contains a battery. Moving up the left side and across the top, there is an ammeter. To the right of the ammeter, the circuit splits into two vertical branches. Each branch has a resistor.

content.answer: The figure presents a circuit that contains a battery, two resistors, and an ammeter. The left side contains a battery. Moving up the left side and across the top, there is an ammeter. To the right of the ammeter, the circuit splits into two vertical branches. Each branch has a resistor.
